name: The BRYN MAWR TRUST COMPANY, James T. Cantwell, Jr. and Charles S. Frank, Jr., Appellants, v. Gregory J. WAX and Narberth Townhomes, Inc., Appellees
name_abbreviation: Bryn Mawr Trust Co. v. Wax

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, CAPPY, CASTILLE and MONTEMURO, JJ.
MONTEMURO, J., is sitting by designation.
parties: The BRYN MAWR TRUST COMPANY, James T. Cantwell, Jr. and Charles S. Frank, Jr., Appellants, v. Gregory J. WAX and Narberth Townhomes, Inc., Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
MONTEMURO, J., is sitting by designation.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Tom P. Monteverde, Lawrence R. Woehrle, Christopher Defalco, John J. Brennan, Philadelphia, for Bryn Mawr Trust Co., et al.
Louise A. Rynd, Harrisburg, for amicus — Pa. Bankers Assoc.
E. Parry Warner, Philadelphia, for G.J. Wax.
casebody.head_matter:
652 A.2d 820
The BRYN MAWR TRUST COMPANY, James T. Cantwell, Jr. and Charles S. Frank, Jr., Appellants, v. Gregory J. WAX and Narberth Townhomes, Inc., Appellees.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 20, 1994.
Decided Jan. 18, 1995.
Tom P. Monteverde, Lawrence R. Woehrle, Christopher Defalco, John J. Brennan, Philadelphia, for Bryn Mawr Trust Co., et al.
Louise A. Rynd, Harrisburg, for amicus — Pa. Bankers Assoc.
E. Parry Warner, Philadelphia, for G.J. Wax.
Before NIX, C.J., and FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, CAPPY, CASTILLE and MONTEMURO, JJ.
